sense.name: enrolling
sense.commentary: REGISTRATION[+event] enrollment, enrolment - the act of enrolling
sense.examples: Registration will begin on Tuesday. Her registration for class was delayed because she hadn't paid tuition.

sense.name: document
sense.commentary: a document certifying an act of registering
sense.examples: George pulled the crumpled registration out of his pocket. Please show your car registration at to the police.

sense.name: people
sense.commentary: enrollment - a body of people (such as students) who register or enroll at the same time
sense.examples: This year's registration will be great students, I think.

sense.name: sound property
sense.commentary: the sound property resulting from a combination of organ stops used to perform a particular piece of music; the technique of selecting and adjusting organ stops
sense.examples: Paul's registration of the organ was flawless. Listen to that fabulous registration.

sense.name: adjustment
sense.commentary: readjustment - the act of adjusting something to match a standard (rarely used)
sense.examples: The registration of the car's engine proved more difficult than expected. Out here they don't call it a tune-up, they call it a registration.
